tasks.task: Understand basic components and operation of an automatic sprinkler system.
subtasks: Identify the water source (e.g., pump, well, or local utility).
Trace the water flow from the source to the backflow preventer via PVC pipes.
Recognize the backflow preventer's function in preventing contaminated water from flowing back into the drinking supply.
Describe the role of the timer/controller in scheduling valve operations.
Explain how valves control water flow to different zones or stations.
Describe the distribution of water from valves through poly or PVC tubing to sprinkler heads.
Distinguish between pop-up and shrub-type sprinklers and their appropriate usage.
Identify rotor and spray sprinklers and their typical applications.
Recall the website (sprinklerwarehouse.com) for product inquiries and customer support.

tasks.task: Evaluate maintenance and troubleshooting aspects of sprinkler systems.
subtasks: Check for signs of water contamination or backflow issues.
Inspect valves and sprinklers for proper sealing and activation.
Adjust sprinkler head settings (e.g., rotation, spray patterns) as needed.
Regularly inspect and replace components like backflow preventers as part of maintenance.

tasks.task: Consider environmental impacts and water conservation practices.
subtasks: Monitor water usage and adjust schedules according to weather conditions.
Implement measures to minimize water waste, such as drip irrigation or smart controllers.
Educate oneself on local water usage regulations and compliance.
